1.text: Add 1 green tea bag or 1 teaspoon (5 g) of loose green tea to a mug.

2.text: Pour 8  fl oz (240 mL) of boiling water over the tea.

3.text: Steep the tea for 3 to 5 minutes.

4.text: Transfer the tea to an air-tight container that can hold 8  fl oz (240 mL).

5.text: Add 1 US tbsp (15 mL) of lemon juice for skin-brightening benefits.

6.text: Pour in 2  fl oz (59 mL) of apple cider vinegar for pH balancing effects.

7.text: Stir in 2 US tbsp (30 mL) of honey for anti-aging benefits.

8.text: Mix in 1 US tbsp (15 mL) of witch hazel for a stronger astringent.

9.text: Add 3-5 drops of vitamin E oil to soothe irritated skin.

10.text: Include up to 30 drops of tea tree oil for a natural acne treatment.

11.text: Mix in up to 30 drops of lavender oil for a relaxing scent.

12.text: Allow the green tea to cool before using it.

13.text: Store your toner in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

15.text: Apply your homemade green tea toner with a cotton ball or spray bottle.

16.text: Moisturize your skin as usual after applying the green tea toner.
